Package xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas

This package provides so-called SweepAreas.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SweepArea<I,E>
    A SweepArea is a highly dynamic datastructure with flexible insertion, retrieval and reorganization capabilities.
    SweepAreaImplementor<E>
    This interface provides the core functionality for an implementor of a SweepArea.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractSAImplementor<E>
    A pre-implementation of the interface SweepAreaImplementor.
    AbstractSweepArea<I,E>  
    BagSAImplementor<E>
    An implementation of the interface SweepAreaImplementor based on the interface Bag.
    CountingSweepArea<I,E>  
    DecoratorSweepArea<I,E>  
    DefaultMemoryManageableSA<I,E>
    Default implementation for a memory manageable SweepArea.
    DefaultMemoryManageableSA.EveryQth<E>
    This inner class provides a predicate for the remove filter for the load shedder.
    HashSAImplementor<E>
    A hash-based implementation of the interface SweepAreaImplementor.
    ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
    A SweepArea is a highly dynamic datastructure with flexible insertion, retrieval and reorganization capabilities.
    ListSAImplementor<E>
    A list-based implementation of the interface SweepAreaImplementor.
    MemoryManageableSA<I,E>
    This abstract class decorates a SweepArea to make it memory manageable.
    SortMergeEquiJoinSA<E>
    A SweepArea for sort-based equijoins.

Package xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas Description

This package provides so-called SweepAreas. A SweepArea is a highly dynamic datastructure with flexible insertion, retrieval and reorganization capabilities. It is utilized to remain the state of an operation.
In order to decouple the reorganization capabilities of a SweepArea from its concrete implementation, the design pattern Bridge was chosen. Therefore, each SweepArea relies on a SweepAreaImplementor. Such an implementor represents the underlying datastructure of a SweepArea, which can be list-, hash- or bag-based for instance.
SweepAreas are predominantly used in join operations. Hence, to understand their usage and semantics, please take a closer look at the package xxl.core.cursors.joins.
